alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 2:17AM CDT until May 07 at 7:18PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Verdigris River at Coffeyville affecting Montgomery County. Verdigris River at Independence affecting Wilson and Montgomery Counties. For the Verdigris River...including Altoona, Independence, Coffeyville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Verdigris River at Coffeyville. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flooding of low-lying areas is expected, especially along the left bank near the Water Plant. Further upstream and downstream from the gage site the river spreads out into the flood plain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 8.9 feet early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Verdigris River Coffeyville 18.0 19.0 Fri 7 pm CDT 13.7 8.6 7.0 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
